author: ajsutton
content:
Really only applicable to client devs, but I've spun up a short-lived, currently Teku only, devnet that will activate Altair at epoch 10 (it's up to epoch 7 currently). https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-networks/tree/master/teku/coorparoo has the specs and some very, very minimal instructions for connecting to it with Teku.

This is definitely not intended to be a public testnet or anything for normal users, will likely hit issues and will be shut down without notice at some point in the not too distant future. But its there if it's useful for anyone to test with.

author: ajsutton
content: For the record Coorparoo is a suburb here in Brisbane - it's nice enough but there's not much reason to go there.

author: ajsutton
content: Having some fun with networking which isn't unexpected.

author: ajsutton
content: The two teku validators are still producing blocks and the chain is finalizing. But post Altair even Teku can't connect to the Teku nodes with discovery (I think the enr hasn't updated with the new fork digest but not entirely sure yet).

author: ajsutton
content: Lodestar and Lighthouse have tried to connect (very quickly - credit to them for being able to react so quickly at all) but are having issues with fork digest mismatches.  Not yet sure if that's configuration or a bug in one or more of the clients.  Or maybe they're trying to use discovery...

author: potuz
content: Argh p2p problems are always awful to diagnose

author: pawandhananjay
content: Fixed the p2p issues with Lighthouse . Getting a state root mismatch on the fork slot though. Dumping the states to file to check the issue there

author: ajsutton
content:
ooo, interesting.  One thing I saw which was odd was that the actual transition epoch didn't finalize.  Participation was still 100% but justification and finalization was delayed by one epoch as the fork happened and then kicked back in.
It wouldn't surprise me if that was a bug in Teku's transition process as that's exactly the area where the reference tests aren't yet working so hasn't been verified.
